problem_text: Let G be a finite group of order n. a) Is it true that |Aut G| ⩾ φ(n) where φ is Euler’s function? b) Is it true that G is cyclic if |Aut G| = φ(n)? M. Deaconescu
answer: Both questions have negative answers; moreover, |Aut G|/φ(|G|) can be made arbitrarily small (J. N. Bray, R. A. Wilson, Bull. London Math. Soc., 37, no. 3 (2005), 381–385).
